sentences.en: ‘He’s such an unpleasant man,’ Alyssia muttered under her breath .
sentences.cn: “他真是个讨厌的人。”阿莉西娅轻声嘟囔着。

sentences.en: "God knows," she muttered, "what's happening in that madman's mind."
sentences.cn: “天知道，”她低声抱怨，“那个疯子脑子里正在想什么。”

sentences.en: Actors often mutter to themselves when rehearsing their lines.
sentences.cn: 演员背台词的时候经常自己嘀嘀咕咕.

sentences.en: Don't mutter! I can't hear you.
sentences.cn: 别叽叽咕咕的! 我听不见.

sentences.en: Elsie muttered something I couldn’t catch and walked off.
sentences.cn: 埃尔茜咕哝了一句什么，我也没有听懂，她就走掉了。

sentences.en: Gro ? mutter : Ich wei ? auch nicht, wann der Regen aufh ? ren wird.
sentences.cn: 我也不知道雨什么时候停.

sentences.en: Hallo, Mutter ! Wir haben jetzt geniesst gehen. Danke scho n. Und Sie?
sentences.cn: 嗨! 妈!我们刚刚吃完晚饭. 谢谢, 那您 呢 ?

sentences.en: He spoke in a mutter.
sentences.cn: 他嘀嘀咕咕轻声说话.

sentences.en: I heard a mutter of discontent.
sentences.cn: 我听到有人小声咕哝着表示不满.

sentences.en: In some cases, are also said mutter disposable wipe.
sentences.cn: 有时, 也说成抹咕丢的.

sentences.en: It's impolite to mutter to one another in class.
sentences.cn: 上课交头接耳不礼貌.

sentences.en: NIV what my enemies whisper and mutter against me all day long.
sentences.cn: [和合]并那些起来攻击我的人,口中所说的话,以及终日向我所设的计谋.

sentences.en: She can hear the old woman muttering about consideration.
sentences.cn: 她能听见这老妇人低声说要考虑考虑。

sentences.en: Some staff members are beginning to mutter about the new President.
sentences.cn: 有些职员开始抱怨新任的总经理.

sentences.en: The button utters in mutter, "The butterfly likes the buttered peanut."
sentences.cn: 按钮咕哝着发出声音说：“蝴蝶喜欢涂了奶油的花生。”

sentences.en: They heard him mutter,'One Hundred and Five, North Tower;'
sentences.cn: 他们听见他低声含糊地 念叨 着“北塔一O五”.

sentences.en: They shake their heads and mutter darkly.
sentences.cn: 他们一边摇头，一边阴沉地小声嘀咕。

sentences.en: We heard a mutter of discontent.
sentences.cn: 我们听到有人窃窃私议表示不满.

sentences.en: We heard the man mutter something as he walked away.
sentences.cn: 我们听见那个人离开时喃喃地说着什么.

sentences.en: Workers continued to mutter about the management.
sentences.cn: 工人私下对资方还是有怨言。

trans.tran_cn: 咕哝，小声低语，小声抱怨，怨言
轻声低语； 小声抱怨
trans.tran_en: to complain about something or express doubts about it, but without saying clearly and openly what you think
to complain about something or express doubts about it, but without saying clearly and openly what you think
If you mutter, you speak very quietly so that you cannot easily be heard, often because you are complaining about something

trans.tran_cn: 轻声低语，咕哝地抱怨，含糊地说，自言自语地说
低声说出（生气或抱怨的话）
trans.tran_en: to speak in a low voice, especially because you are annoyed about something, or you do not want people to hear you
